thread.title: Boys soccer: Sabres head to state
thread.title_full: Boys soccer: Sabres head to state

title: Boys soccer: Sabres head to state
text:
Boys soccer: Sabres head to state Tom Elliott , telliott@stcloudtimes.com 10:27 p.m. CDT October 22, 2015 Buy Photo Sartell's Riley Sanderson (11) kicks the ball into the face of St. Cloud Apollo's Logan Lommel (16) in the first half of their Section 8A championship game Thursday at Husky Stadium. (Photo: Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com) Buy Photo 
A couple weeks ago, Cullen Chisholm was told something no athlete ever wants to hear. 
"I was told I was never playing soccer again," Chisholm said. 
That didn't prove to be quite true. 
Chisholm scored on penalty kick 7:22 into Thursday's Section 8A final, just a minute or two after entering a game for the first time since Oct. 6. 
It helped give Sartell a 2-1 victory over St. Cloud Apollo at St. Cloud State's Husky Stadium. 
"I couldn't be happier," said Chisholm, who has a nearly completely torn rotator cuff in his right shoulder. 
"It's torn from 10 o'clock to 7 o'clock," said the senior attacker, noting those three unmentioned hours are what are keeping him from a total tear. "I'm going to need surgery eventually." 
He hurt it twice this season, the last time against Willmar. He hasn't played since, though he was cleared to play in a shootout situation Saturday. On Thursday, he got the OK from his doctor to play and wore a brace that hindered his shoulder movement. 
"It's incredible," Chisholm said of qualifying for state. "Most people don't get to play in one state tournament and I'm blessed to play in two." Buy Photo Sartell's Trevor Erickson (24) and Ethan Kiffmeyer (16) celebrate their 2-1 win in their Sect. 8A championship game against St. Cloud ApolloThursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Sartell secured a state tournament appearance with the win. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell's Riley Sanderson (11) kicks the ball into the face of St. Cloud Apollo's Logan Lommel (16) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloud Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo's Graham Virtue (12) and Sartell's Justin Hammerel (7) both go down in a battle for the ball during the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell players celebrate their second goal of the game in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game against St. Cloud Apollo Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo's Hamse Sied (6) and Logan Lommel (16) race to the ball ahead of Sartell's Parker Beumer (14) near the Sartell goal in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell's Riley Sanderson (11) beats Apollo's Logan Lommel (16) to the ball in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo's Khadar Mohamed (22) battles Sartell's Austin Sura (3) for control of the ball near Sartell's goal in the second half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Sartell won 2-1, earning them a state tournament berth. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo fans cheer for their team in the second half of their Sect. 8A championship game against Sartell Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. In the end, Sartell came away with a 2-1 win. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo's Khadar Mohamed (22) gets to the ball ahead of Sartell's Ethan Kiffmeyer (16) in the second half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Despite his efforts, Sartell won 2-1, earning them a state tournament berth. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell fans cheer as the final seconds tick off the clock in the second half of their Sect. 8A championship game against St. Cloud Apollo Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. The Sartell Sabres won 2-1. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell's Ethan Kiffmeyer (16) and Trevor Erickson (24) celebrate their 2-1 win in their Sect. 8A championship game against St. Cloud ApolloThursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Sartell secured a state tournament appearance with the win. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell players celebrate their 2-1 win in the Sect. 8A championship game against St. Cloud ApolloThursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Sartell secured a state tournament appearance with the win. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell's Jaylia Ellis (19) gets control of the ball from St. Cloud Apollo's Mikaela Soltis (14) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo's Claire Sautner, left, heads the ball away from Sartell's Bria Ferns (3, right) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell's Tessa Hager (4) watches her shot fly into the net tailed by St. Cloud Apollo's Emily Eiynck (2) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo After making two saves in rapid succession, St. Cloud Apollo's goalkeeper Anna Carlson (97) watches the third ball fly past her for a goal by Sartell's Megan Sieben (5) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell's Laura Leonard (9) drives the ball past St. Cloud Apollo's Mikaela Soltis (14) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo St. Cloud Apollo keeper Anna Carlson (97) falls to the turf after making a save in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Sartell players celebrate their first goal from Tessa Hager (4) in the first half of their Sect. 8A championship game against St. Cloud Apollo Thursday, Oct. 22 at Husky Stadium. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com
